basics.name: Shreyas V
basics.label: AI Research Scientist
basics.summary: AI Research Scientist specializing in AI for Chemistry, Drug Discovery, and Molecular Machine Learning. Led the development of DeepRetro, achieving state-of-the-art results in retrosynthesis.

work.name: MStack AI
work.summary: Designing novel Chemistry-first AI models to tackle Molecule Synthesis and Chemical supply chains. Led the design and development of chemical foundational models for chemical reaction understanding.

work.name: Deep Forest Sciences
work.summary: Led the design and development of DeepRetro: a Chemist's AI Co-Pilot for Collaborative Retrosynthesis.
highlights: Achieved 96.3% success rate on USPTO-190 benchmark
Winner of $100,000 Standard Industries Chemical Innovation Challenge
Migrated DeepChem models from TensorFlow to PyTorch, increasing user base by 92%

work.name: Yale University
work.summary: Conducting research on molecule generation models using geometric deep learning with Prof. Smita Krishnaswamy.

work.name: Harvard Medical School
work.summary: Investigating the neural mechanisms of language processing using AI models under Prof Gabriel Kreiman.

volunteer.summary: Mentored contributors on polymer generative pipelines and model migration from TensorFlow to PyTorch.
highlights: Mentored Debasish Mohanty on polymer generative pipelines
Mentored Bibhusundar Mohapatra on Chemception model migration

volunteer.organization: Google Developer Student Clubs, BITS Goa
volunteer.summary: Guided 25+ ML enthusiasts, conducted weekly training sessions, organized hackathons.
highlights: Organized hackathons and mentored in ML model building

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani - Goa Campus
Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani - Goa Campus

awards.summary: Won $100,000 for DeepRetro - AI-powered retrosynthesis framework

publications.name: DeepRetro: Retrosynthetic Pathway Discovery using Iterative LLM Reasoning
publications.summary: Novel hybrid AI framework for retrosynthesis achieving 96.3% success rate on USPTO-190 benchmark.

publications.name: ChemBERTa-3: An Open Source Training Framework for Chemical Foundation Models
publications.publisher: Royal Society of Chemistry's Digital Discovery
publications.summary: Open source framework for training chemical foundation models.

publications.name: Open Source Molecular Processing Pipeline for Generating Molecules

projects.name: DeepRetro
projects.summary: AI Co-Pilot for Collaborative Retrosynthesis using iterative LLM reasoning. Achieved state-of-the-art 96.3% success rate.

projects.name: DeepChem
projects.summary: Core contributor to the open-source drug discovery toolkit. Migrated models from TensorFlow to PyTorch.
